programme.title: Hungry Hearts
programme.desc: A new mother's increasingly unstable behavior threatens her relationship with her husband (Adam Driver) and the life of her infant.

programme.title: XX/XY
programme.desc: An artist (Mark Ruffalo) begins a romance with a collegian (Maya Stange), then goes his own way and runs into her eight years later.

programme.title: Nobody Knows
programme.desc: A woman abandons her four children (Yûya Yagira, Ayu Kitaura, Hiei Kimura) in a tiny apartment, leaving them to fend for themselves.

programme.title: The Imperialists Are Still Alive!
programme.desc: A French party girl (Élodie Bouchez) in Manhattan finds romance on the same night she learns that her childhood friend has disappeared.

programme.title: Freak Show
programme.desc: Billy, a cross-dressing teen, starts attending an ultra-conservative high school. He takes a stand for his individuality by running for homecoming queen.

programme.title: Red Hook Summer
programme.desc: A well-to-do Atlanta teen (Jules Brown) documents a summer spent in the Brooklyn housing projects with his devout grandfather (Clarke Peters).

programme.title: 44 Inch Chest
programme.desc: A vengeful car salesman (Ray Winstone) and his brutal buddies kidnap his wife's lover, then try to decide if they should kill the man or spare him.

programme.title: Ophelia
programme.desc: Ophelia comes of age as lady-in-waiting for Queen Gertrude, and her singular spirit captures Hamlet's affections. As lust and betrayal threaten the kingdom, Ophelia finds herself trapped between true love and controlling her own destiny.

programme.title: Boyhood
programme.desc: A youngster (Ellar Coltrane) makes the long journey to adulthood over the span of 12 years, as he, his sister (Lorelei Linklater) and his mother (Patricia Arquette) move around Texas.

programme.title: Far North
programme.desc: A soldier interrupts the simple lives of two women.

programme.title: Vita & Virginia
programme.desc: A love affair develops between author Vita Sackville-West and literary icon Virginia Woolf, inspiring one of Woolf's greatest works.

programme.title: Red Hook Summer
programme.desc: A well-to-do Atlanta teen (Jules Brown) documents a summer spent in the Brooklyn housing projects with his devout grandfather (Clarke Peters).
